tool.name: kb-python
tool.description: performs gene and feature quantification on single-cell sequencing data.
tool.command: mkdir ./index && mkdir ./kb_outs #if $refTranscriptSource.TranscriptSource != "indexed": && kb ref -i ./index/kb_ref.idx -g ./index/t2g.txt -f1 ./index/cdna.fa #if $workflow == "lamanno": -f2 ./index/intron.fa -c1 ./index/cdna_t2c.txt -c2 ./index/intron_t2c.txt --workflow $workflow #end if '${refTranscriptSource.s_index.genomic_fasta}' '${refTranscriptSource.s_index.genomic_gtf}' #set $index_path = './index' #else #set $index_path = $refTranscriptSource.index.fields.path #end if && kb count -i $index_path/kb_ref.idx -g $index_path/t2g.txt -x \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-2} #if $whitelist: --whitelist '${optional.whitelist}' #end if #if '${optional.whitelist}': --mm #end if --workflow $workflow #if '${optional.extra_dtype}' == "loom": --loom #elif '${optional.extra_dtype}' == "h5ad": --h5ad #end if -t \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-2} -m \$GALAXY_MEMORY_MB -o ./kb_outs --cellranger $FASTQ1 $FASTQ2

param.name: technology
param.label: Select the scRNA-seq technology:
param.help: Choose the scRNA-seq technology used to generate the fastq data.

param.name: workflow
param.label: Select the workflow you want to use:
param.help: Type of workflow. Use `lamanno` for RNA velocity based on La Manno et al. 2018 logic. Use `nucleus` for RNA velocity on single-nucleus RNA-seq reads. Use `kite` for feature barcoding. Use `kite:10xFB` for 10x Genomics Feature Barcoding technology.

param.name: whitelist
param.label: Whitelist file
param.help: Whitelisted barcodes to correct to. If not provided and bustools supports the technology, a pre-packaged whitelist is used. If not, the bustools whitelist command is used.

param.name: multimap
param.label: Include multi pseudoaligned reads?
param.help: Do you want to include reads that pseudoalign to multiple genes?

param.name: extra_dtype
param.label: Do you want any additional output data type beside CellRanger?

tool.help:
This is a galaxy wrapper for kallisto-bustools (kb) for quantification of different types of single-cell sequencing data. The main kallisto-bustools homepage can be found under: 'kallisto-bustools<https://www.kallistobus.tools/>'.
The kb count command runs the kallisto and bustools programs. It can be used for pre-processing of data from a variety of single-cell RNA-seq technologies, and for a number of different workflows (e.g. production of gene count matrices, RNA velocity analyses, etc.).
The kb package is developed and maintained by the Pachterlab under the MIT License.
